answers.answer: What are the reference ranges for the FT3 and FT4?  Ranges vary lab to lab and have to come from your own report.There are quite a few of us with multiple issues.  I assume that you're being treated for the mono?  Have they determined the cause of the low GFR?  Is this the first time you've had low GFR?A quick google for GFR, I find that if low GFR for 3 months or more, indicates kidney disease.  What were your creatinine levels?http://www.kidneyfund.org/kidney-health/kidney-tests/kidney-test-egfr.htmlYou should ask your doctor when you should test again.Do you have diabetes?

Thanks for your original answer my ranges are belowTSH .8  (.3-3.7)Ft4  .7  (.76-1.46)Ft3  2   (2-4.4)Dr prescribed 25 mcg lexo...?vit D is 41 (30-100)GFR is 48 was 58 4 years ago, bun is 19 (7-18) Creatine 1.2 (.6-1.3)Dr did not even comment on GFR , No diabetesProlactin was H 27 (4.8 - 23.3) still waiting for MRI resultsChronic Active EBV was noted no treatment for the current infectionNot sure what to be concerned about most?  A little concerned about gfrAlso have high blood pressure and migrainesI did go gluten free in the last year and have lost 15 lbs  currently 118, 5'3 so only system of hypo I do not have is he weight gain.

question: I was just diagnosed with hypothyroid after pressing my doctor to look beyond the TSHTSH .8Ft4  .7Ft3  2Then I received even more news  Prolactin is high so I had an MRI yesterday  Then they told  me I have Reactivated Mono  and a low GFR (kidney number) of 48Does any one else have a multitude of issues?
title: Hypothyroid, Mono, and Kidney issues
